examples.description: assigns an instance variable @board to an array with 9 blank spaces " "
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#initialize assigns an instance variable @board to an array with 9 blank spaces " "

examples.description: defines a constant WIN_COMBINATIONS with arrays for each win combination
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe WIN_COMBINATIONS defines a constant WIN_COMBINATIONS with arrays for each win combination

examples.description: prints arbitrary arrangements of the board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#display_board prints arbitrary arrangements of the board

examples.description: allows "X" player in the top left and "O" in the middle
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#move allows "X" player in the top left and "O" in the middle

examples.description: returns true/false based on position in board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#position_taken? returns true/false based on position in board

examples.description: returns true/false based on position
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#valid_move? returns true/false based on position

examples.description: makes valid moves and displays the board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn makes valid moves and displays the board

examples.description: asks for input again after a failed validation
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn asks for input again after a failed validation

examples.description: counts occupied positions
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn_count counts occupied positions

examples.description: returns the correct player, X, for the third move
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#current_player returns the correct player, X, for the third move

examples.description: returns false for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#won? returns false for a draw

examples.description: returns true for a win
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#won? returns true for a win

examples.description: returns true for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#full? returns true for a draw

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#full? returns false for an in-progress game

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns true for a draw

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns false for a won game

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns false for an in-progress game

examples.description: returns true for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#over? returns true for a draw

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#winner return X when X won

examples.description: returns O when O won
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#winner returns O when O won

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#winner returns nil when no winner

examples.description: asks for players input on a turn of the game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play asks for players input on a turn of the game

examples.description: checks if the game is over after every turn
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play checks if the game is over after every turn

examples.description: plays the first turn of the game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play plays the first turn of the game

exception.message:
expected collection contained:  [" ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", "X"]
actual collection contained:    [" ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " "]
the missing elements were:      ["X"]
the extra elements were:        [" "]

examples.description: plays the first few turns of the game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play plays the first few turns of the game

exception.message:
expected collection contained:  [" ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", "O", "X", "X"]
actual collection contained:    [" ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " "]
the missing elements were:      ["O", "X", "X"]
the extra elements were:        [" ", " ", " "]

examples.description: checks if the game is won after every turn
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play checks if the game is won after every turn

exception.message:
(#<TicTacToe:0x0000000002efaa68>).won?(*(any args))
    expected: at least 3 times with any arguments
    received: 0 times with any arguments

examples.description: checks if the game is draw after every turn
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play checks if the game is draw after every turn

exception.message:
(#<TicTacToe:0x0000000002fceb10>).draw?(*(any args))
    expected: at least 3 times with any arguments
    received: 0 times with any arguments

examples.description: stops playing if someone has won
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play stops playing if someone has won

exception.message:
(#<TicTacToe:0x0000000002a1b538>).turn(no args)
    expected: 0 times with any arguments
    received: 1 time

examples.description: congratulates the winner X
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play congratulates the winner X

exception.message: No such file or directory @ rb_sysopen - --format

examples.description: congratulates the winner O
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play congratulates the winner O

exception.message: No such file or directory @ rb_sysopen - documentation

examples.description: stops playing in a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play stops playing in a draw

exception.message:
(#<TicTacToe:0x0000000002a4c0c0>).turn(no args)
    expected: 0 times with any arguments
    received: 1 time

examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play prints "Cats Game!" on a draw

exception.message: No such file or directory @ rb_sysopen - --format

examples.description: plays through an entire game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#play plays through an entire game

exception.message:
#<IO:0x0000000001c1c1f8> received :puts with unexpected arguments
  expected: ("Congratulations X!")
       got: ("Please input a number between 1 and 9") (1 time)
            ("   |   |   ") (3 times)
            ("-----------") (2 times)
